summary: This document is a series of photo sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, documenting a possible suicide attempt involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione on July 23, 2019. It records the time of the incident, the location, and the times photographs were taken by a lieutenant.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate involved in the documented possible suicide attempt at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, also listed as involved in a 'Possible Suicide Attempt(Cellmate)' incident on the same date and time.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The unnamed lieutenant who took the photographs of the incident scene in the Special Housing Unit.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same Special Housing Unit cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at the time of the incident.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: A possible suicide attempt involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione occurred in the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 1:27 AM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, N.Y.
Special Housing Unit (within Metropolitan Correctional Center)
keyFacts: The incident involving Jeffrey Epstein is officially documented as a 'Possible Suicide Attempt' occurring on July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM.
Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, who is also listed in connection with the incident.
A lieutenant took photographs of the scene for the Special Investigative Section, with the first photos of Epstein's cell logged at 1:45 AM and photos related to Tartaglione at 2:25 AM.
The document consists of multiple, nearly identical photo sheet forms, suggesting standard procedure for documenting a serious incident.
The date of this incident (July 23, 2019) precedes Epstein's death, which was ruled a suicide on August 10, 2019.
